Class Alarm

  • java.lang.Object
    • Alarm

  • public class Alarm
extends java.lang.Object
    An Alarm object is made up of a ClockDisplay12 object and a boolean flag indicating whether or not the alarm is set (true means it is set; false means it isn't set)
    Version:
    September 29th, 2017
    Author:
    Mounica Pillarisetty

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Alarm()
      A default constructor (no parameters) that sets the clock to midnight and the alarm off.
      Alarm(int hours, int minutes, java.lang.String AMorPM, java.lang.Boolean alarmON)
      Alarm is a constructor with 4 parameters It initilaizes the alarm to specified time and alarm state from the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getTime()
      returns a String representing the current alarm time
      java.lang.Boolean isSet()
      Checks to see if the alarm is set
      void setTime(int hours, int minutes, java.lang.String AMorPM)
      Sets the alarm time with 3 parameters
      void turnOff()
      Turns off the alarm
      void turnOn()
      Turns the alarm on
